alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 1:44AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Bernard, Orleans, eastern St. Tammany, southeastern Lafourche, Jefferson and Plaquemines Parishes, Harrison, Hancock, northwestern Jackson and southern Pearl River Counties through 345 AM CST... At 144 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Crossroads to 9 miles northeast of Galliano to 79 miles southwest of Cocodrie. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Gulfport, Biloxi, Slidell, Long Beach, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Marrero, Port Sulphur, Chalmette, Galliano, Diamondhead, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Gretna, Pearl River and Golden Meadow. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 236 and 253, and between mile markers 258 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 35. Interstate 12 between mile markers 74 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 near mile marker 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
